summary: The Advocate for Employee Ownership Act (S. 2474) mandates the Secretary of Labor to appoint an Advocate for Employee Ownership within the Employee Ownership Initiative. This advocate will liaise between the Department of Labor and stakeholders, provide education, resolve disputes, and recommend legislative changes to promote employee ownership, particularly through employee stock ownership plans (ESOPs). The bill also outlines the advocate's duties, compensation, reporting requirements, and authorizes appropriations. The aim is to expand employee ownership and support worker rights.
